00124 
00142 int nfs3_Fsinfo( nfs_arg_t               * parg,    
00143                  exportlist_t            * pexport, 
00144                  fsal_op_context_t             * pcontext,   
00145                  cache_inode_client_t    * pclient,
00146                  hash_table_t            * ht,
00147                  struct svc_req          * preq,    
00148                  nfs_res_t               * pres )
00149 {
00150         static char     funcName[] = "nfs3_Fsinfo";
00151 
00152   fsal_accessflags_t        access_mode ;
00153   cache_inode_status_t      cache_status ;
00154   cache_inode_file_type_t   filetype ;
00155   cache_entry_t           * pentry = NULL ;
00156   cache_inode_fsal_data_t   fsal_data ;
00157   fsal_attrib_list_t        attr ;
00158   
00159   /* to avoid setting it on each error case */
00160   pres->res_fsinfo3.FSINFO3res_u.resfail.obj_attributes.attributes_follow = FALSE;
00161 
00162   /* Convert file handle into a fsal_handle */
00163   if( nfs3_FhandleToFSAL( &(parg->arg_fsinfo3.fsroot), &fsal_data.handle, pcontext ) == 0 )
00164         return NFS_REQ_DROP;
00165 
00166   /* Set the cookie */
00167   fsal_data.cookie = DIR_START ;
00168 
00169   /* Get the entry in the cache_inode */
00170   if( ( pentry = cache_inode_get( &fsal_data, 
00171                                   &attr, 
00172                                   ht, 
00173                                   pclient, 
00174                                   pcontext, 
00175                                   &cache_status ) ) == NULL )
00176     {
00177       /* Stale NFS FH ? */
00178       pres->res_fsinfo3.status = NFS3ERR_STALE ;
00179       return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00180     }
00181   
00182   
00183         /*
00184          * New fields were added to nfs_config_t to handle this value. We use
00185          * them 
00186          */
00187 
00188 #define FSINFO_FIELD pres->res_fsinfo3.FSINFO3res_u.resok
00189         FSINFO_FIELD.rtmax  = pexport->MaxRead;
00190         FSINFO_FIELD.rtpref = pexport->PrefRead;
00191 
00192         /* This field is generally unused, it will be removed in V4 */
00193         FSINFO_FIELD.rtmult = DEV_BSIZE;
00194 
00195         FSINFO_FIELD.wtmax  = pexport->MaxWrite;
00196         FSINFO_FIELD.wtpref = pexport->PrefWrite;
00197 
00198         /* This field is generally unused, it will be removed in V4 */
00199         FSINFO_FIELD.wtmult = DEV_BSIZE;
00200 
00201         FSINFO_FIELD.dtpref = pexport->PrefReaddir ;
00202 
00203         FSINFO_FIELD.maxfilesize = FSINFO_MAX_FILESIZE;
00204         FSINFO_FIELD.time_delta.seconds = 1;
00205         FSINFO_FIELD.time_delta.nseconds = 0;
00206 
00207 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
00208         printf("rtmax = %d | rtpref = %d | trmult = %d\n",
00209                FSINFO_FIELD.rtmax, FSINFO_FIELD.rtpref, FSINFO_FIELD.rtmult = DEV_BSIZE);
00210         printf("wtmax = %d | wtpref = %d | wrmult = %d\n",
00211                FSINFO_FIELD.wtmax, FSINFO_FIELD.wtpref, FSINFO_FIELD.wtmult = DEV_BSIZE);
00212         printf("dtpref = %d | maxfilesize = %llu \n", FSINFO_FIELD.dtpref, FSINFO_FIELD.maxfilesize);
00213 #endif
00214 
00215 
00216         /*
00217          * Allow all kinds of operations to be performed on the server
00218          * through NFS v3 
00219          */
00220         FSINFO_FIELD.properties = FSF3_LINK | FSF3_SYMLINK | FSF3_HOMOGENEOUS | FSF3_CANSETTIME;
00221 
00222         nfs_SetPostOpAttr( pcontext, pexport,
00223                      pentry, 
00224                      &attr,
00225                      &(pres->res_fsinfo3.FSINFO3res_u.resok.obj_attributes));
00226         pres->res_fsinfo3.status = NFS3_OK;
00227 
00228 
00229         return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00230 } /* nfs3_Fsinfo */
00231 
00232 
00241 void nfs3_Fsinfo_Free( nfs_res_t * pres )
00242 {
00243   /* Nothing to do */
00244   return ;
00245 } /* nfs3_Fsinfo_Free */
